snippet: Neither the European Central Bank nor the Bank of England had made such a move before. The bid to reassure investors brought them into closer alignment with the Federal Reserve.
abstract: European Central Bank and Bank of England, in unprecedented move, commit themselves to keeping interest rates low for indefinite period; move is meant to reassure investors amid criticism that they have run out of ways to promote growth, and brings banks into closer alignment with openness of Federal Reserve.

byline.original: By JACK EWING and JULIA WERDIGIER
byline.contributor: Jack Ewing reported from Frankfurt, and Julia Werdigier from London.

lead_paragraph: Neither the European Central Bank nor the Bank of England had made such a move before. The bid to reassure investors brought them into closer alignment with the Federal Reserve.

headline.main: 2 Central Banks Promise to Keep Rates Low
headline.print_headline: 2 Central Banks Promise to Keep Rates Low
